intro: Galium asprellum var. typicum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium asprellum var. typicum is a low-growing perennial that spreads through rhizomes, forming dense mats in its native habitat.
